rsn: The first image shows a higher viewpoint, as evidenced by the visibility of the tops of the tables and more of the chalkboard. In the second image, the viewpoint is lower, with less of the table tops visible and more of the chair legs and floor in view. This indicates a downward movement of the camera.
label: down

rsn: In the source image, the camera is positioned higher, capturing more of the tables and chairs from above. In the target image, the camera is positioned lower, closer to the floor, which results in more of the floor being visible and the tables and chairs appearing taller. This indicates a downward movement of the camera.
label: down

rsn: In the source image, the camera is positioned lower, as indicated by the higher perspective of the table and chair. In the target image, the camera is positioned higher, as the table and chair appear lower in the frame. This suggests an upward translation of the camera.
label: up

rsn: In the source image, the camera is positioned higher, looking more directly down at the toilet. In the target image, the camera is positioned lower, showing more of the floor and less of the top of the toilet. This indicates a downward translation of the camera.
label: down
